@graph.rdfs:comment:
The vertical distance between a standard reference point, such as sea level,
      and the top of an object or point on the Earth, such as a mountain.
@graph.rdfs:label: mean elevation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Two digit country code assigned by the International Organization for Standardization
@graph.rdfs:label: ISO Country Code

@graph.rdfs:comment: A broad reference to country's position in the world (ie. Africa).
@graph.rdfs:label: Map Reference

@graph.rdfs:comment: Length of sea belt belonging to sovereign coastal state for exclusive economic use.
@graph.rdfs:label: Territorial Sea

@graph.rdfs:comment: Total border belonging to a soverign nation.
@graph.rdfs:label: National Border

@graph.rdfs:comment: Description of the terrain
@graph.rdfs:label: description

@graph.rdfs:comment: a nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.
@graph.rdfs:label: Country

@graph.rdfs:comment: Geographic section where the land borders the sea.
@graph.rdfs:label: Coast

@graph.dc:creator: William R.A.D. Funk
@graph.dc:rights: Copyright 2019 William R.A.D. Funk. All rights reserved.
@graph.rdfs:comment:
Identifies application specific classes and annotations that are relevant
      only to my associated applications.
@graph.rdfs:label: Funk Ontology

@graph.rdfs:comment: Area within a country's borders (ie. Land, Water, Total).
@graph.rdfs:label: Domain Area

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Length of sea belt belonging to sovereign coastal state for legally protecting against infringement of its customs,
      fiscal, immigration, or sanitary laws and regulations.
@graph.rdfs:label: Contiguous Zone

@graph.rdfs:comment: A stretch of land, especially with regard to its physical features.
@graph.rdfs:label: Natural Resource

@graph.rdfs:comment: Two countries that share a land border.
@graph.rdfs:label: Border Country Pair

@graph.rdfs:comment: Additions, subtractions, or exceptions that pertain to the length of sea belt belonging to a soverign coastal state.
@graph.rdfs:label: Continental Shelf

@graph.rdfs:comment:
The highest vertical distance between a standard reference point, such as sea level,
      and the top of an object or point on the Earth, such as a mountain.
@graph.rdfs:label: highest point

@graph.rdfs:comment: Length of sea belt belonging to sovereign coastal state.
@graph.rdfs:label: Territorial Sea

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Length of sea belt belonging to sovereign coastal state with exclusive jurisdiction for the purpose of exploring it
      and exploiting its natural resources.
@graph.rdfs:label: Continental Shelf

@graph.rdfs:comment: Supplemental description for the lowest elevation point
@graph.rdfs:label: lowest point description

@graph.rdfs:comment: The amount of computer memory the image requires.
@graph.rdfs:label: Image Size

@graph.rdfs:comment: Description of variable length that summarizes the history of a thing.
@graph.rdfs:label: Background information

@graph.rdfs:comment: Greater detail for the climate of a given area.
@graph.rdfs:label: Climate Zone Description

@graph.rdfs:comment:
An area beyond the outer limit of the territorial sea in which the coastal State has the right to fish,
      subject to any concessions which may be granted to foreign fishermen.
@graph.rdfs:label: exclusiveFishingZone

@graph.rdfs:comment: The width and height of the image, usually in pixels
@graph.rdfs:label: Width by Height Dimensions

@graph.rdfs:comment: Total area associated with the entity to which it's attached.
@graph.rdfs:label: Total Area

@graph.rdfs:comment: URL location where image was originally located.
@graph.rdfs:label: Locator URL

@graph.rdfs:comment: Total length of distance by land of a country's border.
@graph.rdfs:label: Total Land Border

@graph.rdfs:comment: Total water area associated with the entity to which it's attached.
@graph.rdfs:label: Water Area

@graph.rdfs:comment: Length of distance by land that one country shares with other countries.
@graph.rdfs:label: Border Length

@graph.rdfs:comment: Supplemental description for the highest elevation point
@graph.rdfs:label: highest point description

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Material or substance such as minerals, forests, water,and fertile land
      that occur in nature and can be used for economic gain.
@graph.rdfs:label: Natural Resource

@graph.rdfs:comment:
a piece of cloth flown by the government of a country,
      and designed with specific meanings for its colours and symbols.
@graph.rdfs:label: NationalFlag

@graph.rdfs:comment:
The vertical distance above the reference geoid,
      a mathematical model of the Earth's sea level as an equipotential gravitational surface.
@graph.rdfs:label: Elevation

@graph.rdfs:comment: an image showing a country's full border and direct neighbors.
@graph.rdfs:label: Border Map Image

@graph.rdfs:comment: Numerical rank compared to similar entities.
@graph.rdfs:label: Area Rank

@graph.rdfs:comment: Name of the climate zone (ie. polar, temperate, etc.).
@graph.rdfs:label: Climate Zone Name

@graph.rdfs:comment: An additional descriptor to add information to a simple length measurement.
@graph.rdfs:label: Length Modifier

@graph.rdfs:comment: The weather conditions prevailing in an area in general or over a long period.
@graph.rdfs:label: Climate

@graph.rdfs:comment: A description of where in the world the country is located.
@graph.rdfs:label: Location Description

@graph.rdfs:comment: Description of the contents contained within the asset.
@graph.rdfs:label: Content Description

@graph.rdfs:comment: The name of the resource (ie. coal, copper, salt, fish)
@graph.rdfs:label: resourceName

@graph.rdfs:comment:
The lowest vertical distance between a standard reference point, such as sea level,
      and the top of an object or point on the Earth, such as a canyon.
@graph.rdfs:label: lowest point

@graph.rdfs:comment: The measurement or extent of something from end to end
@graph.rdfs:label: Length

@graph.rdfs:comment: a digitally stored image
@graph.rdfs:label: Image

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Divisions of the Earth's climates into general climate zones according to average temperatures and average rainfall.
      The three major climate zones on the Earth are the polar, temperate, and tropical zones.
@graph.rdfs:label: Climate Zone

@graph.rdfs:comment: an image showing a country's position within a region.
@graph.rdfs:label: Region Map Image

@graph.rdfs:comment: Total land area associated with the entity to which it's attached.
@graph.rdfs:label: Land Area

@graph.rdfs:comment:
The adjacent belt of sea that extends beyond a coastal state's land territory and internal waters.
      Includes airspace over that belt of sea.
@graph.rdfs:label: Maritime Claim

@graph.rdfs:comment: Total number of countries sharing a border with this nation.
@graph.rdfs:label: Total Border Countries

@graph.rdfs:comment: Comparative association with a well-known area to better define scale qualitatively.
@graph.rdfs:label: Comparative Area

@graph.rdfs:comment: When details are given that don't readily fit into any given category, they go here.
@graph.rdfs:label: supplementalExplanation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Unit of measurement (ie. m, km, mi, sq km, celcius, etc.).
@graph.rdfs:label: Unit
